biog.entry.name: JENSEN, Dr Dennis Geoffrey
biog.entry.description: Biography for JENSEN, Dr Dennis Geoffrey
biog.entry.electorate.name: Tangney
biog.entry.title: Biography for JENSEN, Dr Dennis Geoffrey
biog.entry.electorate.state.name: Member for Tangney (WA)
biog.entry.party.name: Liberal Party of Australia

parliamentary.service.title: Parliamentary Service
parliamentary.service.para: Elected to the House of Representatives for Tangney, Western Australia, 2004, 2007, 2010 and 2013.

committee.service.title: Committee Service
committee.service.para: House of Representatives Standing: Science and Innovation from 1.12.04 to 17.10.07; Industry, Science and Innovation from 11.3.08 to 19.7.10; Transport and Regional Services from 1.12.04 to 17.10.07; Education and Training from 11.3.08 to 19.7.10; Petitions from 25.10.10 (Chair from 12.12.13).
Joint Statutory: Public Accounts and Audit from 29.5.06 to 17.10.07.
Joint Standing: Foreign Affairs, Defence and Trade from 25.10.10; Treaties from 4.12.13.

party.positions.title: Party Positions
party.positions.para: Member, Liberal Party Booragoon Branch from 2009.

quals.work.pre.parliament.title: Qualifications and Occupation before entering Federal Parliament

electorate.title: Electorate
electorate.para: Location: southern Perth; it includes the suburbs of Applecross, Alfred Cove, Ardross, Attadale, Bateman, Booragoon, Bull Creek, Canning Vale, Leeming, Melville, Mount Pleasant, Murdoch, Myaree, Parkwood, Riverton, Rossmoyne, Shelley, Willetton and Winthrop, and parts of Kardinya.
Industries: light industry, retail and service industries.
State electorates: Tangney includes parts of the Western Australian Legislative Assembly electorates of Alfred Cove, Bateman, Jandakot, Riverton, Southern River and Willagee.
